3.name: Jesus Christ
3.occupation: Spiritual teacher and central figure of Christianity

4.name: Buddha
4.occupation: Spiritual Teacher and founder of Buddhism

6.name: Paul of Tarsus
6.occupation: Christian missionary and one of the main writers of the New Testament

10.name: Albert Einstein
10.occupation: German/US scientist discovered Theory of Relativity

11.name: Louis Pasteur
11.occupation: French biologist. Developed cure for rabies and other infectious diseases

12.name: Galileo Galilei
12.occupation: Italian scientist – confirmed heliocentric view of universe

15.name: Moses
15.occupation: A key figure of Jewish / Christian history gave 10 Commandments of Old Testament

16.name: Charles Darwin
16.occupation: Scientist who proposed and popularised theory of evolution

17.name: Shih Huang Ti
17.occupation: King of the state of Qin who conquered and united different regions of China in 221 BC

19.name: Nicolaus Copernicus
19.occupation: Renaissance mathematician and astronomer who believed Sun was centre of Universe – rather than earth

20.name: Antoine Laurent Lavoisier
20.occupation: French chemist and biologist who had leading impact on the chemical revolution

21.name: Constantine the Great
21.occupation: Roman Emperor who accepted Christian religion

22.name: James Watt
22.occupation: Scottish engineer. Watt improved the Newcome steam engine creating an efficient steam engine

23.name: Michael Faraday
23.occupation: English scientist who contributed in fields of electromagnetism and electrochemistry

24.name: James Clerk Maxwell
24.occupation: Scottish physicist. Maxwell made a significant contribution to understanding electromagnetism

25.name: Martin Luther
25.occupation: Sought to reform the Roman Catholic Church – starting the Protestant Reformation

26.name: George Washington
26.occupation: Leader of US forces during American Revolution and 1st President of US

28.name: Orville & Wilbur Wright
28.occupation: Created and flew the first aeroplane

29.name: Genghis Kahn
29.occupation: Military and political leader of the Mongols

30.name: Adam Smith
30.occupation: Scottish social philosopher and pioneer of classical economics

32.name: John Dalton
32.occupation: English chemist and physicist. Made contributions to atomic theory

33.name: Alexander the Great
33.occupation: King of Macedonia and military leader

35.name: Thomas Edison
35.occupation: Inventor and businessman helped introduce electricity and electric light bulbs

37.name: William T.G. Morton
37.occupation: American dentist who pioneered the use of anaesthetic

38.name: Guglielmo Marconi
38.occupation: Italian engineer who helped develop radio transmission

41.name: Oliver Cromwell
41.occupation: Leader of Parliamentarians in English civil war

44.name: John Locke
44.occupation: English political philosopher. Locke promoted a theory of liberal democracy and a social contract

45.name: Ludwig van Beethoven
45.occupation: German composer of the classical and romantic period

46.name: Werner Heisenberg
46.occupation: German theoretical physicist – one of the pioneers of Quantum mechanics

47.name: Louis Daguerre
47.occupation: French artist and photographer, who is credited with the invention of the camera

49.name: Rene Descartes
49.occupation: French philosopher and mathematician. “I think, therefore I am.”

51.name: Pope Urban II
51.occupation: Influential Pope who ordered the first Crusade to the Holy Land and set up the Papal Court

52.name: Umar ibn al-Khattab
52.occupation: Powerful Muslim Caliphate and senior companion of Muhammad. An influential figure in Sunni Islam

53.name: Asoka
53.occupation: Powerful Indian King who established large empire by conquest before converting to Buddhism and pursuing a peaceful approach

54.name: St. Augustine
54.occupation: Influential Christian saint and writer, who shaped much of Western Christian thought

55.name: William Harvey
55.occupation: English physician who made contributions to understanding how blood circulated in the body

56.name: Ernest Rutherford
56.occupation: NZ born British physicist who made discoveries in atomic physics. His work on splitting the atom was influential for the development of atomic science

57.name: John Calvin
57.occupation: Christian theologian who developed a strict brand of Protestant Christianity which stressed the doctrine of predestination

58.name: Gregor Mendel
58.occupation: Czech/Austrian scientist and friar – who founded modern science of genetics

59.name: Max Planck
59.occupation: German theoretical physicist who developed a theory of Quantum physics and discovered energy quanta

60.name: Joseph Lister
60.occupation: British surgeon who pioneered the use of sterilisation and antiseptic surgery

61.name: Nikolaus August Otto
61.occupation: German engineer who developed compressed charge internal combustion engine to run on petrol

62.name: Francisco Pizarro
62.occupation: Spanish Conquistador who claimed Inca lands for Spain

63.name: Hernando Cortes
63.occupation: Spanish Conquistador who conquered the Aztec lands of modern-day Mexico

64.name: Thomas Jefferson
64.occupation: 3rd President of US. Principle author of the US Declaration of Independence

65.name: Queen Isabella I
65.occupation: Queen of Castille, who helped create a powerful and unified state of Spain whose influence spread to the Americas

66.name: Joseph Stalin
66.occupation: Absolute ruler of the Soviet Union from 1924 to his death. Led the Soviet Union in WWII

67.name: Julius Caesar
67.occupation: Roman ruler who oversaw the demise of the Roman Republic to be replaced with a Roman Emperor. Militarily strengthened the power of Rome

69.name: Sigmund Freud
69.occupation: An Austrian neurologist who founded psychoanalysis, which involved the investigation of the subconscious, dreams and human mind

70.name: Edward Jenner
70.occupation: Developed the world’s first vaccine (the smallpox vaccine). Known as the father of immunology

71.name: Wilhelm Conrad Roentgen
71.occupation: German physicist who discovered electromagnetic waves or X-rays

72.name: Johann Sebastian Bach
72.occupation: Composer and organist who created some of the world’s most beautiful music

73.name: Lao Tzu
73.occupation: Author of Tao Te Ching and founder of Taoism

74.name: Voltaire
74.occupation: A key figure of European Enlightenment. His satirical writings played a role in the French Revolution

75.name: Johannes Kepler
75.occupation: German mathematician and astronomer who created laws of planetary motion

76.name: Enrico Fermi
76.occupation: Italian-American physicist who created the first nuclear reactor

77.name: Leonhard Euler
77.occupation: Swiss mathematician who made prolific discoveries in calculus and graph theory

78.name: Jean-Jacques Rousseau
78.occupation: French philosopher, author of Social Contract

79.name: Niccolo Machiavelli
79.occupation: Italian diplomat and Renaissance writer considered the father of political science

80.name: Thomas Malthus
80.occupation: English scholar who raised concern over growing population

81.name: John F. Kennedy
81.occupation: 38th President of the US. Served at the height of the Cold War and helped defuse Cuban Missile Crisis

82.name: Gregory Pincus
82.occupation: American biologist who created the oral contraceptive pill

83.name: Mani
83.occupation: Iranian founder of Manichaeism, a gnostic religion which for a time was a rival to Christianity

84.name: Lenin
84.occupation: Leader of the Russian Revolution and new Communist regime from 1917 to 1924

85.name: Sui Wen Ti
85.occupation: Founder of China’s Sui Dynasty and reunifying China in 589

86.name: Vasco da Gama
86.occupation: Portuguese explorer, first European to reach India and establish a route for imperialism

87.name: Cyrus the Great
87.occupation: Founder of the Achaemenid Empire, the first Persian Empire. Relatively enlightened ruler

88.name: Peter the Great
88.occupation: Russian Emperor who expanded the Tsarist Empire to make Russia European power

89.name: Mao Zedong
89.occupation: Leader of the Communist Revolution and dictator of China from 1949-1974

90.name: Francis Bacon
90.occupation: Creator of the scientific method and key figure in Scientific Revolution of the Enlightenment

91.name: Henry Ford
91.occupation: Owner of Ford Motor Company. Revolutionised mass-production techniques

92.name: Mencius
92.occupation: Chinese philosopher one of the principal interpreters of Confucianism.

93.name: Zoroaster
93.occupation: Iranian prophet who founded the religion of Zoroastrianism

94.name: Queen Elizabeth I
94.occupation: Queen of England from 1558 to her death in 1603. Cemented England as a Protestant country, defeated Spanish Armada

95.name: Mikhail Gorbachev
95.occupation: Leader of Soviet Communist Party who pursued reform – perestroika and glasnost to open Eastern Europe to democracy

96.name: Menes
96.occupation: Egyptian pharaoh who united Upper and Lower Egypt to found the First Dynasty

97.name: Charlemagne
97.occupation: United Europe to form the Carolingian Empire. First western Emperor since the fall of Rome

98.name: Homer
98.occupation: Greek poet who wrote Iliad and Odyssey
